metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2220 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in the radius_get_vendor_attr function in the Radiusextension before 1.2.7 for PHP allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a large VendorSpecific Attributes (VSA) length value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2220` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php5-radius - 1.2.5-2.4build1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: php-radius package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.5-2.4build1').
